content.question: For time t ≥ 0 hours, let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGYbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaIXaGaaGOmaiaaicdapaGaaGjbV=qadaqadaWdaeaapeGaaGymai abgkHiTiaadwgapaWaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaeyOeI0IaaGymaiaaicda caWG0bWdamaaCaaameqabaWdbiaaikdaaaaaaaGccaGLOaGaayzkaa aaaa@4785@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> represent the speed, in kilometers per hour, at which a car travels along a straight road. The number of liters of gasoline used by the car to travel x kilometers is modeled by g(x) = 0.05x(1 - e-x/2). (a) How many kilometers does the car travel during the first 2 hours?

frqParts.text: For time t ≥ 0 hours, let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGYbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaIXaGaaGOmaiaaicdapaGaaGjbV=qadaqadaWdaeaapeGaaGymai abgkHiTiaadwgapaWaaWbaaSqabeaapeGaeyOeI0IaaGymaiaaicda caWG0bWdamaaCaaameqabaWdbiaaikdaaaaaaaGccaGLOaGaayzkaa aaaa@4785@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> represent the speed, in kilometers per hour, at which a car travels along a straight road. The number of liters of gasoline used by the car to travel x kilometers is modeled by g(x) = 0.05x(1 - e-x/2). (a) How many kilometers does the car travel during the first 2 hours?
(b) Find the rate of change with respect to time of the number of liters of gasoline used by the car when t = 2 hours. Indicate units of measure.
(c) How many liters of gasoline have been used by the car when it reaches a speed of 80 kilometers per hour?

topic.text: 4.3: Rates of Change in Applied Contexts Other Than Motion

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify common underlying structures in problems involving different contextual situations.
